summary: This document is an email chain from August 2021 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutors discussing a potential interview with a new victim who reported being sexually assaulted by Ghislaine Maxwell. The prosecutors debate the timing of the interview, preferring to wait until after Maxwell's trial, and reference two other victims from the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the underlying case; prosecutors are discussing a spinoff interview related to her. The new victim reported being sexually assaulted by her.

events.title: Tentative interview scheduled
events.description: A tentative interview with a victim's attorney was scheduled for this date, as mentioned in an earlier email from May 2021.

events.title: Prosecutors discuss new victim interview
events.description: Prosecutors correspond about a new victim who reported being sexually assaulted by Ghislaine Maxwell and discuss the timing of an interview, preferring to wait until after Maxwell's trial.

keyFacts: Prosecutors from the SDNY Public Corruption Unit are discussing a 'spinoff interview' related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
A new victim, represented by an attorney, reported being sexually assaulted by Ghislaine Maxwell.
The prosecutors' preferred plan is to wait until after Maxwell's trial to interview this new victim.
The email chain references two other victims from the Epstein investigation who were assaulted by Maxwell and discussed it during initial FBI interviews.
All identifiable names of prosecutors and agents are redacted, indicated by placeholders like '(USANYS)'.
